name: Can I 'Pop' You A Question Or Two? Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: This Englishman invented the board game Clue in 1944?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Pratt.

	It was Colonel Mustard, in the billiard room, with a lead pipe. By the way, William Henry Pratt was the real name of actor Boris Karloff.

questions.text: Which of the following was NOT a Muppet movie?
questions.correct: The Muppets Take Hoboken , But Soon Return It
questions.explanation:
The Muppets Take Hoboken , But Soon Return It.

	Movie great Orson Welles made a brief appearance in 'The Muppet Movie', the first of the series.

questions.text: What is the poker hand, known as 'Dead Man's Hand', that was held by Wild Bill Hickok when he was killed?
options: A full house, kings and queens
questions.explanation:
Two pairs, aces and eights.

	Hickok was killed by Jack McCall on August 2, 1876, in Deadwood, South Dakota.

questions.text: This grocery store chain was founded on September 6, 1916 in Memphis, Tennessee?
options: The Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company
questions.explanation:
The Piggly Wiggly.

	Clarence Saunders was the founder of this chain. I wonder if he was related to the Colonel? Just imagine, Kentucky Fried Pork!

questions.text: What was the name of the actor who portrayed Dr. Watson in the popular Sherlock Holmes movies?
questions.explanation:
Nigel Bruce.

	The 'Hound of the Baskervilles', the first of many Sherlock Holmes' movies, starred Basil Rathbone too. Elementary.

questions.text: What was the name of U.S. President Herbert Hoover's pet dog?
questions.explanation:
King Tut.

	Herbert Hoover was the 31st president. His administration was dominated by the early years of the Great Depression.

questions.text: What was unique about Republican Rebecca Felton, besides the fact that she was the first woman to serve in the U.S. Senate?
questions.correct: She served for only one day
options: She was the cousin of George Washington
questions.explanation:
She served for only one day.

	The Republican from Georgia served her country on November 22 1922.

questions.text: What Clark Gable movie was watched by bank robber John Dillinger before being gunned down by F.B.I. agents?
questions.explanation:
Manhattan Melodrama.

	Dillinger was watching it at Chicago's Biograph Theatre on July 22, 1934.

questions.text: In the English version of Monopoly, what is the equivalent of the American 'Boardwalk' ?
questions.explanation:
Mayfair.

	The English version is based on London streets as the American version is based on Atlantic City streets.

questions.text: Which of these performers did not make an appearance at Woodstock?
questions.explanation:
Deep Purple.

	The Woodstock Music and Arts Fair was held in Bethel, New York on August 15 through 17, 1969.
